groovyx.gaelyk.query
[Groovy] Class SortClause

java.lang.Object
  groovyx.gaelyk.query.Clause
      groovyx.gaelyk.query.SortClause

class SortClause
extends Clause

A sort clause representing an ordering along a certain entity property. The syntax of a sort clause looks like sort desc by column or sort asc by column.

Authors:
Guillaume Laforge
Since:
1.0

Property Summary
def direction

The direction used for sorting: either ascending or descending.
 
Method Summary
QueryBuilder by(def col)

The by() method is the second part of the sort clause, and references the column on which the sorting is done.
 
Methods inherited from class Object
wait, wait, wait, equals, toString, hashCode, getClass, notify, notifyAll
 

Property Detail

direction

def direction
The direction used for sorting: either ascending or descending.

 
Method Detail

by

QueryBuilder by(def col)
The by() method is the second part of the sort clause, and references the column on which the sorting is done.
throws:
QuerySyntaxException when a problem is encountered in the syntax of the sort clause
Parameters:
col - the column on which the sort clause is applied
Returns:
the query builder, for chaining purpose
